alert.note: Alert for Inland Jefferson; Inland Taylor; Lafayette; Madison (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 7:16AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN LAFAYETTE...CENTRAL JEFFERSON...NORTHEASTERN TAYLOR AND MADISON COUNTIES THROUGH 800 AM EDT... At 716 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southeast of Monticello, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Madison, Greenville, Lee, Iddo, Moseley Hall, Ebb, Chancey, Secotan, Boyd, Lamont, Hopewell, Eridu, Mayo Junction, Lake Bird, Day, Sirmans, and Shady Grove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Inland Jefferson; Inland Taylor; Lafayette; Madison
